channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #90 - Raising money for a Perl project
item.description:
Hi,

brian d foy is running an fund-raiser on behalf of Jeffrey Thalhammer (author of Perl::Critic and Pinto) to improve Pinto. I believe that the greater Perl community - including all the readers of the Perl Weekly and a lot of other people who don't (yet) read it can start putting some money together for such project. Even if each person only gave $5 or $10, that will quickly tilt the project.

My question: do you think that allowing certain people to work on open source projects (in this case Jeff), can help you? - Check out the link below to see the explanation of brian d foy and let's see how quickly we can raise the remaining amount? On the Crowdtilt page you can see that both Yanick (who put together a large chunk of this edition), and myself have already contributed a bit.

In other news there are going to be 3 Perl Workshops this weekend. See if one of them is near to you!

Enjoy

item.title: Lokku is hiring Perl Developers to work on our Nestoria property search engine
item.description:
Nestoria helps millions of house hunters in eight countries and six languages. We're looking for 2 developers to help us solve search problems like keyword extraction, geocoding, de-duplication, and serving our users at lightning speed.
Contact us at perldeveloper@lokku.com if you're interested!

item.title: We're Hiring Telecommuters - Grant Street Group
item.description:
We're a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications.

We're looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Email resume: 106686-CS-6734@grantstreet.hrmdirect.com

item.title: rt.cpan.org new features and upgrade to RT 4.0.11
item.description: rt.cpan.org has been upgraded! Here's a list of what's new and shiny.

item.title: Crowd-funding Pinto
item.description: brian d foy launched a Crowdtilt campaign to fund the development of Pinto (and by ricochet Stratopan). We could probably wax poetically about the usefulness of Pinto, the shininess of Stratopan and the awesomeness of Jeff Thalhammer but, really, I think it could all be summarized by "shut up and take my money!".

item.title: New Catalyst Release and Zombie-Boomstick Retrospective
item.description: A new version of Catalyst is on CPAN, with improvements both touching the code and the project itself. John Napiorkowski walks us through them.

item.title: Perl startup powering Dashboard at Downing Street, expanding internationally
item.description: Adzuna is a London startup running on Perl. And, as we can see, they are doing quite well. Quite well indeed.

item.title: How to be agile without testing
item.description: For a developer, it's all bugs. Well, it ain't, Ovid points out: there is bugs, and then there is unforeseen behaviors. And while the first group is almost always bad news, the second group can be... surprising.

item.title: NYTProf v5 - Flaming Precision
item.description: There's a new Devel::NYTProf in town, and boy does it look HOT.

item.title: CPAN Testers Summary - April 2013 - Go For It
item.description: This monthly report was written before the QA Hackathon that took place over the week-end. The number of reports is approaching 30 million!

item.title: Perl QA Hackathon 2013 in Lancaster - notes by Wendy
item.description: This part 1 of the series in which Wendy van Dijk reports about the QA Hackathon that too place last week-end. It provides some insight to what went on during the Hackathon.

item.title: Flattr your CPAN Stack
item.description: Inspired by the Pinto Crowdtilt initiative, Yanick plays around with a way to aggregate all CPAN authors part of a machine's stack, and feed the result to the micro-donation web service Flattr.

item.title: Dotfiles distribution
item.description: How do they deal with configuration file management at Booking.com? This is how.

item.title: Reviewing my own regular expressions
item.description: How hard is it to extract all the regular expressions within a Perl project? Thanks to PPI and Peter Makholm's skills, much less than you would think.

item.title: I published another 10 of my projects to GitHub
item.description: Peteris Krumins pushed a bunch of utility scripts to GitHub. We bet some of them could also be useful to you.

item.title: Keeping an eye on request duration
item.description: tinita shows us how to monitor and graph the request durations of a web application via munin and a crafty little perl script (natch).

item.title: Is Bread::Board the right tool for this job?
item.description: For once, the title is not a rhetorical question. domm walks us through the problem he has, and tries to figure out if Bread::Board is the solution he is looking for.

item.title: DKIM, Email::Simple, and heartache
item.description: DKIM is one of the tools available for legitimate e-mail senders to fight being falsely marked as spammer. Hence it is important to to know how to use it.

item.title: Sqitch: Now with SQLite Support
item.description: AS you might remember Squich is an SQL change manager tool written in Perl. It supports PostgreSQL, and MySQL, and now it also supports SQLite.

item.title: Notes from a Newbie 15: Edit, Delete and View Members
item.description: Nolan Joseph Axford (j0e) is unstoppable. He keeps working on his Catalyst based application and he keeps writing about it!

item.title: Getting started with OOP using Moo
item.description: This is my new, experimental screencast. What do you think?

item.title: parser updates
item.description: Reini Urban gives us an update on p2, the new perl11 VM. ... wait, did I just said "Perl 11"?

item.title: Talk Schedule for YAPC::NA is online
item.description: Now that the schedule is available it might be a good opportunity to mention the 7 'Master classes' before and after YAPC. Two of them taught by myself (Gabor).

item.title: MetaCPAN weekly report - Devel::NYTProf
StackOverflow Perl report
Perl 6 changes - 2013W15
Scalar and List context in Perl, the size of an array
item.description: Context sensitivity is one of the strange features of Perl 5. This part of the Perl Maven Tutorial tries to explain it a bit.

item.title: trim - removing leading and trailing white spaces with Perl
item.description: Removing leading and trailing white spaces is one of the big bike-shedding issues.

item.title: Subroutines and functions in Perl
item.description: The first steps towards better structured application and code-reuse is creating functions. Here are the basics.

item.title: OSDC.tw - Open Source Developers Conference - Taiwan
item.description: April 19-20, 2013, Taipei, Taiwan

item.title: Dutch Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: April 19, 2013, Arnhem, The Netherlands

item.title: DC Baltimore Perl Workshop
item.description: April 20, 2013, Baltimore, DC, USA
